title: Zucchini Tomato Pie (Community Enhanced)
ingredients: 1/2 cup cooked Italian ground sausage, 1/2 cup lean hamburger
1 teaspoon Italian herbs, 1 clove minced garlic
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Coat a 10-inch pie plate with cooking spray.
Combine zucchini, tomato, onion, and Parmesan cheese in the prepared pie plate.
Saute onions until caramelized. Cook zucchini and tomatoes separately in skillets and drain well before mixing.
Beat baking mix, eggs, milk, salt, and black pepper together in a bowl until smooth; pour over zucchini mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven until a knife inserted into center comes out clean, about 30 minutes.
Weave a top crust with pizza dough for added crunch and presentation.

source_review.text: I followed the other suggestions and ramped up the flavor with Italian herbs and garlic. I increased the parmesan cheese and made it a meal with protein by pre-cooking in a skillet, 1/2 italian ground sausage and 1/2 lean hamburger. I sauteed the onions until carmelized and also cooked the zucchini and tomatoes separately in skillets and drained well befre mixing. I also had some pizza dough on hand so I weaved a top crust to give it some crunch and add to the presentation.

modifications_applied.reasoning: The user added Italian herbs, garlic, increased Parmesan cheese, and added protein to enhance the flavor and make the dish more filling.

description: Zucchini, tomato, and onion combine with Parmesan cheese and baking mix, like Bisquick, to make this pie recipe a snap to throw together on a summer day.
